column4: not really, for ubuntu the 10.10 just refers to the year/date more then anything
i didn't want to cite windows NT version numbers. or mac OS. mac os X has 10 in front of the major number (currently 5) followed by minor (currently 2 or something) so mac os X 10.5.2
verion numbering is done at the discretion of the developer or marketing (team). the only real convention is that higher means newer
